executive_summary: The Bed and Mattress Stores industry has expanded strongly over the five years to 2023. Mattresses are ubiquitous products with very few widespread alternatives, which supports relatively consistent expansion. Several factors have come together during the period to accelerate that boost. The primary downstream market for mattress stores is households, and as the residential market saw a post-recessionary jump, visible through boosted consumer spending, confidence, and housing starts, the customer base for mattress stores shot up. Consumers outfitting new homes or moving into existing homes purchased mattresses at a strengthening rate during the current period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Product Line Expansion Has Offered Mattress Stores Additional Opportunities
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mattresses made of viscoelastic foam, also called memory foam, have expanded in popularity as production processes have streamlined, matured and become less expensive. That's why these products have become much more affordable and common in the consumer market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Growing External Competition Harms Traditional Retailers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mass merchandisers and warehouse clubs, including Walmart and Costco, compete with bed and mattress stores mostly on smaller items, including desks, chairs, cabinets, mattresses, living room sets and dining tables. COVID-19 has accelerated the shift towards online shopping, with many consumers discovering the ease of purchasing beds and mattresses from e-commerce platforms like Wayfair, Overstock, and Furniture.com.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Specialized Mattress Stores See More Expansion Opportunities As Demand For Specialized Mattress Stores Swells
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumer demand for expert knowledge in mattress products has driven expansion in specialized mattress stores. As more people recognize the importance of a good night's sleep, more customers have sought products tailored to their specific needs and preferences, leading to a surge in specialized mattress stores.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: External Factors Have Benefited Mattress Store Owners
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mattress stores have benefited from expanding awareness of the health benefits of sleep. A greater focus by Americans on getting more sleep spurred more mattress purchases during the current period, as consumers seek to sleep for longer and more fulfilling periods of time.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: High-Tech Adjustable Beds And Mattresses: A Thing Of The Present And Future
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With the global economy improving, people now have more disposable income, which is driving the demand for specialized adjustable beds and mattresses. As consumers look for ways to enhance their sleep experience and improve their quality of life, they are willing to invest in high-tech sleep solutions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Innovations Will Continue To Transform The Bed And Mattress Industry Over The Coming Years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The expanding demand for specialty mattresses like latex and viscoelastic memory foam has led to additional opportunities for manufacturers. These materials provide superior comfort and support, leading customers to willingly pay higher prices for the associated benefits.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Traditional Retailers Will Offer Additional Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers will continue to purchase beds and mattresses online, which will make having an online platform a priority for bed and mattress retailers in the US. To remain competitive, traditional bed and mattress stores will continue to focus on offering value-added services, including strong customer service and material customizations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Uncertain Economic Conditions Will Hinder Growth, Nonetheless
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Federal Reserve has shared its intentions to continue raising interest rates to control inflation. This trend of swelling interest rates will impact the residential market negatively, as financing options for housing purchases will become more expensive.

industry_definition: This industry sells sleep equipment, including mattresses, box springs, cots, bedding, pillows and waterbeds. The industry excludes wholesale furniture distributors, such as department stores or direct non-store retailers, as well as sales of other bedroom furniture. Revenue from sales of sleep sofas, daybeds, futons and other dual-purpose furniture is not included in industry revenue.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: Bed and mattress stores are highly competitive. Competition for these stores lies internally (between bed and mattress stores) and externally (between bed and mattress stores and other industries).
Strong external competition pushes bed and mattress prices down

market_segmentation.segment_description: Rising college enrollment rates have driven demand for beds among consumers under 25. This has been somewhat constrained by young adults moving back home with their families, but the growth in the college mattress purchasing market has vastly outweighed concerns about home formation. Consumers aged 25-34 contribute significantly to the industry, as they establish new households and purchase bedroom essentials. In addition, this segment includes families with newborn children for which beds, bedding and frames must be purchased. Young families enjoy boosted financial security, opting to invest in quality sleep solutions and elevate their bedroom experience.

Consumers aged 35 to 54 make up a whopping 37.6% of 2021 mattress sales, thanks to higher incomes and new home purchases. Millennials delaying homeownership until later in life amplifies this segment's dominance in the mattress market. When they purchase houses, consumers typically purchase new mattresses, bedding and box springs to accompany new furniture. As they approach retirement, the older end of this age group is keen on home remodeling, further fueling the demand for new beds and bedding.

55+ consumers account for 35.1% of mattress sales, being the second-largest consumer group in the industry. Financially secure, this age group contributes significantly to both new and replacement mattress purchases. As retirement approaches, many in this demographic are moving to new homes and opting for fresh, comfortable mattresses.

products_and_services.product_description: Queen-sized mattresses reign supreme, accounting for an estimated 41.4% of revenue in 2023, thanks to their comfortable compromise of size and affordability.
Full-sized mattresses, which are 54 inches wide and 74 inches long, meanwhile, account for an approximate 18.0% of revenue.
King-sized mattresses, at 76 inches wide and 80 inches long are anticipated to account for an expected 17.8% of revenue in 2023.

Twin-sized mattresses, that measure 38 inches wide and 74 inches long, are often considered only for children because of size constrains and king-sized mattresses retail at a sticker price that many value shoppers consider out of their price range. These beds represent an estimated 17.2% of revenue.
In the world of niche bedding, specialty mattresses such as the California King or co-sleeping beds contribute to the remaining expected 5.6% of 2023 industry revenue.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: A household is defined as a person or group of persons occupying a single housing unit, like a house, apartment or mobile home. Mattress stores benefit from household formation because people often buy a new bed or mattress when moving into a new home. The number of households will strengthen in 2023, representing an opportunity for mattress stores in the US.

regulations_points.regulation_title: OPEN-FLAME MATTRESS FLAMMABILITY STANDARD (16 CFR PART 1633)
regulations_points.regulation_description: This regulation made mattresses harder to burn and at a slower rate to contain fires more easily. It made the mattresses slightly more expensive to produce.

The Sherman Act, the Wilson Act, the Clayton Act and the Robinson-Patman Act aim to maintain a free and competitive economy by prohibiting the formation of monopolies, conspiracies that restrain import trade, certain forms of price discrimination and providing some protection to small independent retailers and their suppliers from unfair competition.

regulations_points.regulation_title: FEDERAL CONSUMER CREDIT PROTECTION ACT (TRUTH IN LENDING)
regulations_points.regulation_description: This law impacts credit programs offered by retailers by specifying a written disclosure of information relating to financing.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE FEDERAL FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE FEDERAL EQUAL CREDIT OPPORTUNITY ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: This act prohibits discriminating against any credit applicants based on certain grounds.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: This act regulates how payments are collected on credit accounts.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: High inventory levels are vital for bed and mattress stores
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: High inventory levels are vital for bed and mattress stores, as they need a wide product range to avoid losing sales to competitors.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs account for a massive 49.8% of revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs account for a massive 49.8% of bed and mattress store revenue, highlighting the importance of wise purchasing decisions and maintaining the right product mix.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in the housing market impact demand for beds and mattresses
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for new beds and mattresses is largely influenced by changes in the residential market. In 2021, the residential sector benefited from growing disposable income and historically low interest rates, boosting housing starts and existing home sales. Consumers commonly purchase new beds and mattresses when they move, boosting demand for bed and mattress stores. Rising inflation and interest rates have resulted in a weaker real estate sector. Higher interest rates increase long-term borrowing costs, making big-ticket purchases more expensive and discouraging them.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Macroeconomic conditions drive bed and mattress sales
volatility_points.volatility_description: In most cases, new beds and mattresses are considered discretionary purchases, making them susceptible to consumer spending and disposable income changes. When disposable income is high, consumers are more apt to replace their existing mattress. Strengthening inflation boosts the cost of living, pushing down discretionary spending. This generally pushes consumers to minimize unnecessary expenditures or purchase more affordable beds and mattresses.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: SPECIALTY MATTRESSES ARE GAINING GROUND IN THE BED AND MATTRESS MARKET
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The popularity of traditional innerspring mattresses has been declining as specialty mattresses, such as memory foam and air chamber mattresses, have steadily gained market share. Leading brands like Tempur-Pedic and Sleep Number continue to drive innovation and consumer interest in specialty mattresses with premium features and adjustable firmness levels. The reduced price gap between specialty and traditional mattresses, thanks to more efficient production processes, has made these sleep-supporting innovations more accessible to a broader range of customers.

Retailers have been forced to offer additional services to compete with warehouse clubs and supercenters. Retailers implemented financing services to mitigate losses, allowing consumers to make various payments. This allows consumers to make smaller payments every month, lowering the initial cost of beds and mattresses.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Having a diversified product range is crucial to attracting customers of all walks of life.

FAQs.question: Do your company's advertising campaigns target a wide range of consumers?
FAQs.answer: In addition to having a diverse product range, companies must reach out to a wide range of consumers, all of whom are looking for a particular product to fit their needs.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to retain talented employees with specialized knowledge?
FAQs.answer: Bed and mattress stores with only a brick-and-mortar presence retain the competitive advantage over online retailers of providing knowledgeable, in-person assistance.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities to expand reach and minimize overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: The largest bed and mattress stores have expanded substantially during the period as a result of acquisition activity.

FAQs.question: Point-of-sale (POS) systems have become a key technology for retailers. POS systems help aggregate all data into one system, like inventory, tracking, sales and manage employees in real time. Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems or any other management technology?
FAQs.answer: Companies use POS systems to keep track of the most popular items by analyzing what consumers order to ensure that these items are kept in stock.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Some bed and mattress store owners have expanded to offer their products online (sales of which are now included in this industry) to remain competitive as online mattress sales continue to swell. New online brands are becoming expansively popular among younger consumers.

FAQs.question: A lot of new regulation regarding how to safely operate a store during the pandemic have been introduced.
FAQs.answer: Typically, bedding and mattress stores are subject to very little regulation.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: The International Sleep Products Association aims to support the mattress manufacturing industry through education initiatives, active public policy, encouraging uniformity in industry standards and government regulations and facilitate networking of manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit compare with your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: While overall profit doesn't vary significantly across the industry, some products, like high-end and premium mattresses, come with a higher profit margin than others.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Many companies offer financing on big-ticket items, like couches and dining room sets, to attract a broader range of customers. For example, financing companies like Klarna and Afterpay set up payment plans for customers that are typically interest-free if paid on time.

FAQs.question: How do you hire workers? What is the training process for new hires like?
FAQs.answer: Bed and mattress store owners should ensure staff are capable of addressing consumer queries and providing sound advice in regard to mattress functionality. This is especially important for bed and mattress stores as consumers typically like to compare different mattresses and ask employers questions.

FAQs.question: Do you have a reputation for selling quality products? Do you manufacture any branded products?
FAQs.answer: Bed and mattress stores should stock brands that consumers can readily recognize. Since beds and mattresses are expensive, consumers tend to purchase brands they are familiar with.

FAQs.question: Is your company dominant in any particular regional markets? Are your establishments situated in convenient locations?
FAQs.answer: Stores should be located where there's a high volume of passing traffic so as to maximize store exposure to prospective consumers. Being in areas with many homeowners will boost success.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuations in the world price of crude oil impact your production? What percent of your company's sales are connected to oil-based inputs?
FAQs.answer: Changes in the price of oil impact the price of polyurethane foam, a main input material for mattresses.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of boosting disposable income levels? What products sell best during times of higher income levels?
FAQs.answer: Per capita disposable income determines an individual's ability to purchase goods or services, including a bed or mattress. People are more likely to buy a high-end mattress when they have more money to spend.

FAQs.question: How can you take advantage of this cohort? What value-added products can you offer households in this income bracket?
FAQs.answer: Households earning more than $100,000 are more likely to furnish guest bedrooms or invest in multiple properties. That's why these households are also more likely to own several beds per person.
